summary: This is an email chain from April 15, 2020, between U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and an unnamed recipient, discussing a New York Times article's description of an alleged incident where Ghislaine Maxwell performed a massage on a victim, exposing and massaging her chest. The emails focus on the explicit nature of the account.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: The sender/recipient of the emails, asking for and discussing the explicit details of an alleged massage incident described in a news article.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described in the quoted article text as performing a massage on a victim, exposing her breasts and massaging her chest.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in the quoted article text as being present in the area during the alleged massage incident, making the victim feel he could see her.

persons.name: Mike Baker
persons.context: The byline or source quoted in the New York Times article describing the alleged massage incident.

connections.description: The document implies their association during the alleged incident, with Epstein present while Maxwell performed the massage.
The email quotes describe Maxwell performing an inappropriate, sexualized massage on the victim.

events.title: Alleged Inappropriate Massage by Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: As described in a New York Times article, Ghislaine Maxwell performed a massage on a victim, had her lie on her back, pulled down the sheet to expose her breasts, and massaged her chest, while Jeffrey Epstein was sensed to be nearby.

keyFacts: A 2020 email chain shows U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman directly seeking and discussing explicit details from a New York Times article about an alleged abuse incident involving Ghislaine Maxwell.
The described incident involves Maxwell performing a massage on a victim, exposing her breasts, and massaging her chest, which the victim found uncomfortable and inappropriate.
The account states Jeffrey Epstein was present in the area during the massage, making the victim feel he could see her.
The communication highlights the prosecution's focus on gathering specific, explicit evidence of Maxwell's alleged misconduct.
